<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/08/tokyo-olympics-numbers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tokyo Olympics: By the Numbers
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/08/tokyo-olympics-numbers?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="LONDON, ENGLAND - AUGUST 05:  Runners leave the starters block to start ..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTQzL29seW1waWNzX2RheV85Xy1fYXRobGV0aWMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Adam Pretty/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just as we finally figured out how to watch the Olympics, they ended on Sunday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From the moving family watch party videos to the thrusting Australian swim coach, the Tokyo Olympics gave us all a desperately needed distraction while raising thorny questions about the future of the Games. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are the numbers that tell the story of the weirdest Olympics ever.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">113: </strong>The number of total medals the US <a href="https://nypost.com/2021/08/08/olympics-2020-medal-count-team-usa-rallies-for-most-gold/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">won</a> at the Olympics, 25 more than second-place China. Team USA also made a last-second comeback to grab the most number of gold medals at the Games, 39 to China’s 38.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$15.4 billion: </strong>The official <a href="https://apnews.com/article/2020-tokyo-olympics-games-total-cost-8ec49ea2ea9d7316f37ffd20770a2742?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">price tag</a> for the Tokyo Olympics, making it the most expensive Games ever staged.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">0.02%: </strong>The Covid-19 <a href="https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2021/08/08/national/tokyo-games-coronavirus-cases/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">test positivity rate</a> for people participating in the Olympics. Organizers found 430 Olympics-related infections since July 1 out of 624,000 tests, and no serious cases. Overall, the bubble created for more than 50,000 people held up really well.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">16 million: </strong>Instagram interactions for Simone Biles’s account during the Olympics, <a href="https://www.axios.com/biles-social-media-olympics-5b0d999d-d27e-4b88-bede-c3ed479a84c8.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Axios</a>. The famed US gymnast, who withdrew from most competitions over mental health concerns, had the top eight Instagram posts among all American athletes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">42%: </strong>The <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/05/business/media/nbc-olympics-tv-ratings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decrease in viewership</a> from the 2016 Rio Olympics to the Tokyo Games through Tuesday. NBCUniversal, which paid more than $1 billion to air the Olympics, struggled with a whacky time zone difference, lower enthusiasm, and its own confusing menu of viewing options.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">179: </strong>Days until the Winter Olympics kick off in Beijing, which is already facing a number of coronavirus and <a href="https://www.axios.com/beijing-2022-winter-olympics-what-to-expect-54b73e36-aeb3-4825-b037-ff1827653d7d.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">geopolitical questions</a>. More than 180 human rights groups have called for a boycott over China’s treatment of the Uighurs, officially considered a “genocide” by the US government. Major corporate sponsors, like Visa and Coca-Cola, remain on board for now despite pressure. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looking beyond this winter, Paris will host the 2024 Summer Games, followed by LA in 2028.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/08/apple-gets-praised-blasted-new-scanning-feature?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple Gets Praised, Blasted for New Scanning Feature
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple reignited the “what happens on your phone, stays on your phone” debate when it <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/08/05/apple-child-pornography-iphone/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">introduced new features</a> last week intended to clamp down on child abuse content.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company said its new technology, called NeuralHash, will scan US iPhones for images of child sexual abuse that have also been uploaded to iCloud. If a photo is matched to one in an existing database of child pornography images, it will have a human team review its accuracy then flag it for authorities.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The supporters: </strong>Many parents, probably, and governments across the world who’ve pressured tech companies to proactively root out abusive content. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Key soundbite: </strong></span><span>“Apple’s plans to combat child sexual exploitation are a welcome, innovative, and bold step,” Sen. Richard Blumenthal </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/SenBlumenthal/status/1423397902672662529?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1423397902672662529%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.technologyreview.com%2F2021%2F08%2F06%2F1030852%2Fapple-child-abuse-scanning-surveillance%2F" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a></span><span>.</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The opponents: </strong>Privacy activists and other tech companies who say Apple’s moves could allow bad actors to exploit greater access to someone’s personal device.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Key soundbite: </strong></span><span>“This is an Apple-built and operated surveillance system that could very easily be used to scan private content for anything they or a government decides it wants to control,” the head of Facebook’s WhatsApp Will Cathcart </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/wcathcart/status/1423701479613894657?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Apple’s scanning technology is part of a larger suite of child protection features that Apple will roll out with its new mobile operating system, iOS 15, next month.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/08/senate-debates-crypto-provision-opponents-say-harm-industry-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Crypto Industry After Reading the Infrastructure Bill
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/08/senate-debates-crypto-provision-opponents-say-harm-industry-us?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Ron Burgundy saying "What is this, amateur hour?"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3DzwbT4oF52JG/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='Ron Burgundy saying "What is this, amateur hour?"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3DzwbT4oF52JG/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The passage of an infrastructure bill that would bolster investment in one of humanity’s oldest inventions—roads and bridges—is being complicated by a debate over one of its newest: cryptocurrencies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tucked in to the $1.2 trillion infrastructure bill is a provision that <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/08/06/crypto-bitcoin-infrastructure-senate/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expands the definition</a> of a crypto “broker,” and increases reporting requirements by those brokers to the IRS. The goal is to use the $28 billion raised through tighter crypto regulation to help pay for the infrastructure bill.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s not playing well in cryptoland</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The provision “<a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/coinbase-ceo-brian-armstrong-says-192444291.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">makes no sense</a>,” Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong tweeted last week, arguing that the rules would wrap so much red tape around crypto that key players would leave the US for locations with less regulation. Even Elon Musk <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tesla-musk-urges-lawmakers-weighing-011300764.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chimed in</a>, saying, “There is no crisis that compels hasty legislation.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some senators agree, and several of them introduced changes (endorsed by the White House) that would limit the crypto participants exposed to the new reporting requirements. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>once this and other issues get resolved, a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-08/infrastructure-hits-senate-speed-bump-as-debate-slows-to-crawl?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">final vote</a> looks likely to happen Tuesday.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/08/key-performance-indicators-august-9?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Average pay at US supermarkets and restaurants hit <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/08/08/fifteen-dollar-wage/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$15/hour</a> for the first time ever, according to the Washington Post. Nearly 80% of US workers now earn a minimum of $15/hour, compared to 60% in 2014. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The circumstances have changed.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Randi Weingarten, the president of the second-largest teachers union in the country, the American Federation of Teachers, said on <em>Meet the Press </em>that she had <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-teachers-union-shifts-stance-back-vaccine-mandate-covid-surges-2021-08-08/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reversed</a> her thinking and now supports a vaccine mandate for teachers. “It weighs really heavily on me that kids under 12 can't get vaccinated,” Weingarten said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>What do you do with a billion grams of surplus weed? <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Inflation: </strong>Six letters could help determine what happens next on Wall Street—<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/06/inflation-will-be-the-sizzling-topic-for-markets-in-the-week-ahead-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CPI and PPI</a>. The consumer price index and the producer price index, which drop Wed. and Thurs., respectively, will reveal the extent of price increases in July for consumers and businesses. Higher inflation, paired with Friday’s strong jobs report, could encourage the Fed to wind down some of its pandemic-era stimulus measures in the next few months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>S&P 500 companies are estimated to have increased earnings <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/record-pace-for-corporate-earnings-keeps-stocks-buoyant-11628415002?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">90% during Q2 from a year earlier</a>, when the pandemic forced the economy into hibernation. This week’s slate of earnings reports includes meme stock AMC, SoftBank, Coinbase, eBay, Wendy’s, Disney, Palantir, DoorDash, and Airbnb.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Islamic New Year begins this evening.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Samsung’s Unpacked event is on Thursday with a look at </span><span><a href="https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/how-to-watch-samsung-unpacked-galaxy-z-fold-3-z-flip-3/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new foldable phone models</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Friday is the 13th. Prepare accordingly.</span></li>
</ul>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere are the numbers that tell the story of the weirdest Olympics ever.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e113: \u003c/strong\u003eThe number of total medals the US \u003ca href=\"https://nypost.com/2021/08/08/olympics-2020-medal-count-team-usa-rallies-for-most-gold/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewon\u003c/a\u003e at the Olympics, 25 more than second-place China. Team USA also made a last-second comeback to grab the most number of gold medals at the Games, 39 to China’s 38.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$15.4 billion: \u003c/strong\u003eThe official \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/2020-tokyo-olympics-games-total-cost-8ec49ea2ea9d7316f37ffd20770a2742?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprice tag\u003c/a\u003e for the Tokyo Olympics, making it the most expensive Games ever staged.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e0.02%: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Covid-19 \u003ca href=\"https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2021/08/08/national/tokyo-games-coronavirus-cases/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etest positivity rate\u003c/a\u003e for people participating in the Olympics. Organizers found 430 Olympics-related infections since July 1 out of 624,000 tests, and no serious cases. Overall, the bubble created for more than 50,000 people held up really well.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e16 million: \u003c/strong\u003eInstagram interactions for Simone Biles’s account during the Olympics, \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/biles-social-media-olympics-5b0d999d-d27e-4b88-bede-c3ed479a84c8.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Axios\u003c/a\u003e. The famed US gymnast, who withdrew from most competitions over mental health concerns, had the top eight Instagram posts among all American athletes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e42%: \u003c/strong\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/05/business/media/nbc-olympics-tv-ratings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecrease in viewership\u003c/a\u003e from the 2016 Rio Olympics to the Tokyo Games through Tuesday. NBCUniversal, which paid more than $1 billion to air the Olympics, struggled with a whacky time zone difference, lower enthusiasm, and its own confusing menu of viewing options.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e179: \u003c/strong\u003eDays until the Winter Olympics kick off in Beijing, which is already facing a number of coronavirus and \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/beijing-2022-winter-olympics-what-to-expect-54b73e36-aeb3-4825-b037-ff1827653d7d.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egeopolitical questions\u003c/a\u003e. More than 180 human rights groups have called for a boycott over China’s treatment of the Uighurs, officially considered a “genocide” by the US government. Major corporate sponsors, like Visa and Coca-Cola, remain on board for now despite pressure. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLooking beyond this winter, Paris will host the 2024 Summer Games, followed by LA in 2028.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Feature\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple reignited the “what happens on your phone, stays on your phone” debate when it \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/08/05/apple-child-pornography-iphone/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eintroduced new features\u003c/a\u003e last week intended to clamp down on child abuse content.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company said its new technology, called NeuralHash, will scan US iPhones for images of child sexual abuse that have also been uploaded to iCloud. If a photo is matched to one in an existing database of child pornography images, it will have a human team review its accuracy then flag it for authorities.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe supporters: \u003c/strong\u003eMany parents, probably, and governments across the world who’ve pressured tech companies to proactively root out abusive content. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKey soundbite: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Apple’s plans to combat child sexual exploitation are a welcome, innovative, and bold step,” Sen. Richard Blumenthal \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/SenBlumenthal/status/1423397902672662529?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1423397902672662529%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_\u0026ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.technologyreview.com%2F2021%2F08%2F06%2F1030852%2Fapple-child-abuse-scanning-surveillance%2F\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe opponents: \u003c/strong\u003ePrivacy activists and other tech companies who say Apple’s moves could allow bad actors to exploit greater access to someone’s personal device.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKey soundbite: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“This is an Apple-built and operated surveillance system that could very easily be used to scan private content for anything they or a government decides it wants to control,” the head of Facebook’s WhatsApp Will Cathcart \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/wcathcart/status/1423701479613894657?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eApple’s scanning technology is part of a larger suite of child protection features that Apple will roll out with its new mobile operating system, iOS 15, next month.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe passage of an infrastructure bill that would bolster investment in one of humanity’s oldest inventions—roads and bridges—is being complicated by a debate over one of its newest: cryptocurrencies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTucked in to the $1.2 trillion infrastructure rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpands the definition\u003c/a\u003e of a crypto “broker,” and increases reporting requirements by those brokers to the IRS. The goal is to use the $28 billion raised through tighter crypto regulation to help pay for the infrastructure bill.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat’s not playing well in cryptoland\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe provision “\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/coinbase-ceo-brian-armstrong-says-192444291.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emakes no sense\u003c/a\u003e,” Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong tweeted last week, arguing that the rules would wrap so much red tape around crypto that key players would leave the US for locations with less regulation. Even Elon Musk \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tesla-musk-urges-lawmakers-weighing-011300764.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echimed in\u003c/a\u003e, saying, “There is no crisis that compels hasty legislation.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome senators agree, and several of them introduced changes (endorsed by the White House) that would limit the crypto participants exposed to the new reporting requirements. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eonce this and other issues get resolved, a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-08/infrastructure-hits-senate-speed-bump-as-debate-slows-to-crawl?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinal vote\u003c/a\u003e looks likely to happen Tuesday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F08%2Fsenate-debates-crypto-provision-opponents-say-harm-industry-us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
